Description: Textile fragment; torn strip of undyed, medium quality linen cloth, probably from a mummy-wrapping; deterioration on edges due to contact with black bitumen(?). Side edges torn, ends cut. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.26 ends per 10mm and weft c.10-11 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: Cut edges represent modern cutting as mummy was unwrapped. Probably from the same cloth, or at least from the same mummy as BM 6547 - BM 1552. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1993]
